messages.title: This community is my home
messages.content: I want to make our area a better place for all of us. Below I set out some of my priorities if I am elected as our MP.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Fight against Tory privatisation of our NHS and for more investment in our struggling hospitals.
Will fight for more visible police and PCSOs on our streets to make it a safer, more secure community.
Address the postcode lottery in our schools and put teachers, parents and communities first.
Put the environment back on the agenda and fight to stop unnecessary development on our precious greenbelt.
Campaign for more affordable and reliable public transport that will serve passengers, not the shareholders.

mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: David Cameron, Nigel Farage, Nick Clegg

issues.economy: Labour pledges tough action on cost of living. The Tories and Liberal Democrats have presided over the steepest fall in living standards since the 1870s
issues.education: Labour will act on our school place crisis. Labour will protect the Universal Free School Meals and the 'Forced' Academies.
issues.environment: Put the environment back on the agenda and fight to stop unnecessary development on our precious greenbelt.
issues.health: Labour will fight against Tory privatisation of our NHS.

housing.content: Campaign for more affordable and reliable public transport that will serve passengers, not the shareholders.

endorsements.endorsement: Jamie has a deep appreciation for schools and our community.
He is the right choice for Pudsey and for our NHS.

images.caption: Labour will fight low pay and living standards.
Labour will act on our school place crisis.
Only Labour can save the NHS.
Labour pledges tough action on cost of living.

leaflet.additionalNotes: In 2010, the Tories won by only 1659 votes. If you want the Labour MP and interested in helping us win on May 7th and would be interested in volunteering.
